preface.title: Foreword
preface.para: This book was made possible by the sales success of the first edition, so I want to thank you.

The last few years have been active ones in the VoIP world. My work with Asterisk has brought me not simply to Digium's headquarters in Huntsville, Alabama, but also to Toronto (to visit Sangoma), Chicago (ClueCon) and Bucharest (Yate). I learned much about Asterisk, but also a lot about Yate and FreeSwitch, both interesting open-source VoIP alternatives.

Asterisk has progressed mightily since the first edition. My colleague, Philipp Kempgen, helped me tremendously and has left his mark on the new edition. This edition is not only more comprehensive, but also better organized than the first. We made it our goal to make this book serve as a quick and easy introduction to Asterisk for the beginner, while also being a complete reference book for the professional. Leafing through this new edition I still find areas I wish I could have expanded on further or covered more completely. Maybe that's the lot of the author. Certainly Asterisk and VoIP are such large subject areas that one could easily fill another two or three books as thick as this one with interesting content.

This edition is being released in both the original German and English at the same time. There are some differences in the English edition which reflect the different technologies in use in North America, particularly as it concerns ISDN. You can find the German edition as per usual at www.das-asterisk-buch.de and the English version at www.the-asterisk-book.com.
Once again, I welcome your feedback, praise and criticism. Please send it to me at stefan.wintermeyer@amooma.de.

It has been a special privilege and a wonderful experience to work with Stefan on the translation of this book into English. As it happens, Stefan speaks English quite well; being the consummate professional that he is, he knew that a competent English version would need a dedicated translator. To be entrusted with this task has been an honor. I was also charged with some of the adaptations and changes for the English edition, including for the chapter on ISDN and for the hardware installation chapter.

Translations are never easy endeavors, but like poetry, a technical translation is a special kind of beast. I hope that the book you have in your hands proves readable and helpful. Like Stefan, I welcome your feedback. Please send it to me at sbosch@vodacomm.ca.
